com.swirl

Class Region

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.swirl.SObject
      • com.swirl.Signal
        • com.swirl.Region

  • public class Region
extends Signal
    A Region represents a latitude and longitude and a radius defining a circular area with an additional optional set of points representing a polygon refinement of that circular area. There are two types of Regions in use by the library: geofence and control.

    Geofences have Location and Placement associated to them and are typically created and managed by users. Control regions have no Location or Placement Objects associated to them and are used internally for controlling signal detection. For example, with Beacons control regions are used to turn on and off bluetooth scanning and to indicate which iBeacon UUIDs are nearby etc.

    In order to manage very large sets of regions and to preserve battery, regions are managed in batches. The mobile device fetches a set of region metadata periodically and caches that information locally. The set of regions fetched is determined by application-key and geographical location. By default, the library fetches 1 degree of latitude and longitude's worth of region metadata and caches that on both a time basis (12 to 24 hours) and a location basis.
